meanings.sent1: I picked a ripe shadberry from the bush.
meanings.sent2: The children enjoyed eating the sweet shadberries from the tree.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel stole a shadberry and ran up the tree to eat it.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the burst of flavor from a shadberry in my mouth.
meanings.sent5: The sun-kissed shadberry glistened temptingly among the leaves.

meanings.definition: A shrub or small tree that produces shadberries.
meanings.sent1: The shadberry bush in our garden is full of ripe fruits.
meanings.sent2: The farmer planted several shadberry trees along the fence.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat climbed the shadberry tree and refused to come down.
meanings.sent4: The shadberry bush stood like a sentinel guarding the garden.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the shadberry blossoms filled the air with sweetness.
